definition: training in the basic skills/knowledge of the fundamentals
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base

sentences.english: This demonstrates the strong academic foundation Roche.
sentences.chinese: 这体现了罗氏深厚的学术功底。

sentences.english: Lawyer Litao has deep theoretical background and rich practicing experience.
sentences.chinese: 李涛律师具有深厚的理论功底和丰富的实践经验。

sentences.english: To train the famous doctors is a systemic program, which needs the combination of the practice and theory.
sentences.chinese: 造就名医是个系统工程，理论和实践统一才有功底。

sentences.english: If you’re not math-inclined, this may look quite scary at first, but don’t worry: using the formula is straightforward.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的数学功底不深，这个公式看起来很吓人。

sentences.english: He is well grounded in Latin.
sentences.chinese: 他拉丁语的功底很扎实。

sentences.english: Writing plays requires master of words and stage experience.
sentences.chinese: 具备文字功底和舞台经验。

sentences.english: For my painting skills, it can not be very good, but still at stake.
sentences.chinese: 对于我的画画功底，说不上很好，但还是有的。

sentences.english: Interior design school, no art skills in the end work?
sentences.chinese: 学室内设计，没有美术功底到底行不行？

sentences.english: I am a good accountant and have a thorough knowledge of the English language。
sentences.chinese: 我是一个优秀的会计员，同时有很强的英文功底。

definition: level of mastery (of a skill or area of knowledge)/(archaic) to pay a visit to sb
